name: Commandos 3: Destination Berlin
description: Commandos 3: Destination Berlin is a game of real-time tactics that places you in command of an elite unit of Special Forces behind enemy lines in the European theater of World War II. From the shores of France to the heart of the Third Reich, strike fast from land or sea infiltrating hostile territories and conducting raids to disrupt...
minimum_requirements: Operating System: Microsoft Windows 98SE/2000/XP (Admin rights required), Pentium III 700 Mhz (or Athlon(tm) equivalent) Windows 7 Service Pack 1 and above are unsupported at this time. Graphics: 128 MB on Windows 98SE, 256 on Windows 2000/XP, 32 MB DirectX 9 compatible 3D Graphics card (nVidia GeForce or Ati Radeon Chipset), Windows 98SE/2000/XP-compatible sound card (100% DirectX 9-compatible) Hard Drive Space: 2 GB free disk space Other: mouse and keyboard. Multiplayer Requirements: Pentium® III 1.0 GHz (or Athlon(tm) equivalent), 256 MB, 64 MB GeForce or ATI Radeon equivalent, LAN, ADSL or Cable Modem

reviews.review_text: I have played all of the games in the commandos franchise except from the s*** 'strike force' yes some would say this is a let down from the amazing commandos 2 men of courage but the company wanted to change the style of gameplay and graphics but in hole this game is a great laugh a nice new hours worth of challenges and has a nice story and not to mention amazing graphics.  Graphics +++++ Gameplay +++ Story ++ Controls++
The game lacks updates. There is no support or wish to fix the stuff you have to do manually, which pisses me off. They still want your money, but don't care about the product anymore.
Short, straightforward, too action-like, the difficulty laughable...  As put by others - the worst commandos in the series. (I don't count strike force as commandos ;)

5/10. Not a bad game by any means but I can't understand the changes made from 2 to 3. Definitely a step backwards and only worth buying cause it's so cheap. It is glitchy and awkward and needs some settings modified which I'm too lazy to do on a game that's $3.
I cant play this game, Screen starts to flicker when i run the game. i would like if i can get a refund as ive only played like 20 minutes.
It's good.

Yeah, playing it, I found it to be...well its a LITTLE flickery, if you use the scope the colors are distorted so you can't see jack squat, etc. From what I've heard there are too many timed missions...SCREW THAT NOISE because seriously!? I just want to play the game at my own pace....2 works A-OK even though it *along with the first two* have problems with being fullscreen, not that it doesn't work its just a bit strange, sometimes vocal briefings do not work but you can still play *Just good luck figuring things out*  WOW...lets stop that train of thought, I was reviewing the third, not the series in terms of performance on Windows 8!  But yeah play Commandos, its expansion, and 2 instead.

I'm sure this game has a cult following, and I had always been interested in giving the series a try since seeing the cover of the game on store shelves as a kid, but now that I picked it up during a sale I find the controls incredibly cumbersome... It seems pretty hardcore to learn how to play. Maybe I'll get around to giving it a go, but as of now I'm not very interested in slowly progressing. Though crawling towards dudes while getting blasted has been good for some laughs..

I feel that Commandos 2 was a better game than this one.  This has nice interior camera movement and graphics, but resolution is locked. And the timed missions...they suck, it became a more action focused game :( and the controlls in general do not flow as well as in Commandos 2, makis timed missions a pain, without time to enjoy the enviroment.  Seams that Commandos 2 you failed because you messed up, in 3 it seams they want you to fail completly. Better controlls and better resolution would make this game better.

I like how most Positive Reviews come from people who have not played this game, like at all. Most people seem to have like 0.1hrs, I don't really have that much game experience, ON STEAM, with Commandos 2 or 3. But I grew up playing these games, DEFINITELY one of the best strategy and tactical games that will ever exist. I find these games VERY Difficult nowadays, but back in the day when they were the only games I played, I just couldn't stop.  It's only 3.99euros ... Buy these games, except the for the first ones unless you want the complete Commandos experience. Definitely worth your money!!
